verses.verse: Now therefore, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us; (Ex. 20:18, 19; Deut. 18:16) if we hear the voice of the LORD our God anymore, then we shall die.
(Deut. 4:33) For who is there of all flesh who has heard the voice of the living God speaking from the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived?
You go near and hear all that the LORD our God may say, and (Ex. 20:19; Heb. 12:19) tell us all that the LORD our God says to you, and we will hear and do it.’

“Then the LORD heard the voice of your words when you spoke to me, and the LORD said to me: ‘I have heard the voice of the words of this people which they have spoken to you. (Deut. 18:17) They are right in all that they have spoken.

(Deut. 32:29; Ps. 81:13; Is. 48:18) Oh, that they had such a heart in them that they would fear Me and (Deut. 11:1) always keep all My commandments, (Deut. 4:40) that it might be well with them and with their children forever!
Go and say to them, “Return to your tents.”

But as for you, stand here by Me, ((Gal. 3:19)) and I will speak to you all the commandments, the statutes, and the judgments which you shall teach them, that they may observe them in the land which I am giving them to possess.’
“Therefore you shall be careful to do as the LORD your God has commanded you; (Deut. 17:20; 28:14; Josh. 1:7; 23:6; Prov. 4:27) you shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.

You shall walk in (Deut. 10:12; Ps. 119:3; Jer. 7:23; Luke 1:6) all the ways which the LORD your God has commanded you, that you may live (Deut. 4:40; Eph. 6:3) and that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which you shall possess.

The Greatest Commandment “Now this is (Deut. 12:1) the commandment, and these are the statutes and judgments which the LORD your God has commanded to teach you, that you may observe them in the land which you are crossing over to possess,

(Ex. 20:20; Deut. 10:12, 13; (Ps. 111:10; 128:1; Eccl. 12:13)) that you may fear the LORD your God, to keep all His statutes and His commandments which I command you, you and your son and your grandson, all the days of your life, (Deut. 4:40) and that your days may be prolonged.

Therefore hear, O Israel, and be careful to observe it, that it may be well with you, and that you may (Deut. 7:13) multiply greatly (Gen. 22:17) as the LORD God of your fathers has promised you— (Ex. 3:8, 17) ‘a land flowing with milk and honey.’
(Deut. 4:35; Mark 12:29; John 17:3; (1 Cor. 8:4, 6)) “Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one!
(Matt. 22:37; Mark 12:30; Luke 10:27) You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, (2 Kin. 23:25) with all your soul, and with all your strength.
“And (Deut. 11:18-20; Ps. 119:11, 98) these words which I command you today shall be in your heart.
(Deut. 4:9; 11:19; (Eph. 6:4)) You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, when you walk by the way, when you lie down, and when you rise up.
(Ex. 12:14; 13:9, 16; Deut. 11:18; Prov. 3:3; 6:21; 7:3) You shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes.
(Deut. 11:20; Is. 57:8) You shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.

Caution Against Disobedience “So it shall be, when the LORD your God brings you into the land of which He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give you large and beautiful cities (Deut. 9:1; 19:1; Josh. 24:13; Ps. 105:44) which you did not build,

houses full of all good things, which you did not fill, hewn-out wells which you did not dig, vineyards and olive trees which you did not plant— (Deut. 8:10; 11:15; 14:29) when you have eaten and are full—
then beware, lest you forget the (Deut. 8:11-18) LORD who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
You shall (Deut. 13:4; Matt. 4:10; Luke 4:8) fear the LORD your God and serve Him, and (Deut. 5:11; (Is. 45:23; Jer. 4:2)) shall take oaths in His name.
You shall not go after other gods, (Deut. 13:7) the gods of the peoples who are all around you
(for (Ex. 20:5; Deut. 4:24) the LORD your God is a jealous God (Ex. 33:3) among you), lest the anger of the LORD your God be aroused against you and destroy you from the face of the earth.
(Matt. 4:7; Luke 4:12) “You shall not tempt the LORD your God ((1 Cor. 10:9)) as you tempted Him in Massah.
